00033 #ifndef LIBPMEMOBJ_INTEGER_SEQUENCE_HPP
00034 #define LIBPMEMOBJ_INTEGER_SEQUENCE_HPP
00035 
00036 #include <stddef.h>
00037 
00043 namespace nvml
00044 {
00045 
00046 namespace detail
00047 {
00048 
00049 /*
00050  * Base index type template.
00051  */
00052 template <typename T, T...>
00053 struct integer_sequence {
00054 };
00055 
00056 /*
00057  * Size_t specialization of the integer sequence.
00058  */
00059 template <size_t... Indices>
00060 using index_sequence = integer_sequence<size_t, Indices...>;
00061 
00062 /*
00063  * Empty base class.
00064  *
00065  * Subject of empty base optimization.
00066  */
00067 template <typename T, T I, typename... Types>
00068 struct make_integer_seq_impl;
00069 
00070 /*
00071  * Class ending recursive variadic template peeling.
00072  */
00073 template <typename T, T I, T... Indices>
00074 struct make_integer_seq_impl<T, I, integer_sequence<T, Indices...>> {
00075         typedef integer_sequence<T, Indices...> type;
00076 };
00077 
00078 /*
00079  * Recursively create index while peeling off the types.
00080  */
00081 template <typename N, N I, N... Indices, typename T, typename... Types>
00082 struct make_integer_seq_impl<N, I, integer_sequence<N, Indices...>, T,
00083                              Types...> {
00084         typedef typename make_integer_seq_impl<
00085                 N, I + 1, integer_sequence<N, Indices..., I>, Types...>::type
00086                 type;
00087 };
00088 
00089 /*
00090  * Make index sequence entry point.
00091  */
00092 template <typename... Types>
00093 using make_index_sequence =
00094         make_integer_seq_impl<size_t, 0, integer_sequence<size_t>, Types...>;
00095 
00096 } /* namespace detail */
00097 
00098 } /* namespace nvml */
00099 
00100 #endif /* LIBPMEMOBJ_INTEGER_SEQUENCE_HPP */
